yet.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: used in negative statements and questions to talk about whether something that was expected has happened
yet.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: I haven’t asked him yet  (=but I will).
yet.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: used in negative statements and questions to talk about whether a situation has started to exist
yet.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: ‘How are you going to get there?’ ‘I don’t know yet.’
Women didn’t yet have the vote  (=at that time).
yet.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: used in negative sentences to say that someone should not or need not do something now, although they may have to do it later
yet.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Don’t go yet. I like talking to you.
yet.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: used to emphasize that something is even more than it was before or is in addition to what existed before
yet.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: yet another reason to be cautious
The meeting has been cancelled yet again (=one more time after many others).
He got a call from the factory, telling of yet more problems.
Inflation had risen to a yet higher level.
yet.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: used to introduce a fact, situation, or quality that is surprising after what you have just said
yet.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Kelly was a convicted criminal, yet many people admired him.
She does not speak our language and yet she seems to understand what we say.
a story that is strange yet true
an inexpensive yet effective solution to our problem
